ovdesc.p: Payoff property class is used to produce pay off statement which is a document prepared by the bank and given to the customer when a loan payoff is considered. It shows the current status of the loan account, all sums due and the daily rate of interest. It is also referred to as “Letter of Demand”. Additionally a per-diem amount is also shown in the statement - the daily interest amount is charged additionally until the pay-off statement expires.
The payoff amounts would be calculated using simulation framework.

Defines the settlement activity to be automatically invoked while calculating the payoff amount in simulation mode or when the arrangement is payed off in live using SETTLE activity of PAYOFF property class. It is important that the activity definition caters for settling all dues linked to the arrangement contract either by itself or through remainder actvitiy definitions.
Validations:
Should a valid ID in AA.ACTIVITY table.
Activity class of the activity can only be APPLYPAYMENT
activity of payment rules property class.

Defines the settlement activity to be automatically invoked when due amounts between the simulation start date and payoff effective date are to considered as settled. It is important that the activity definition caters for settling the dues linked to the arrangement contract either by itself or through remainder actvitiy definitions.
Validations:
Should a valid ID in AA.ACTIVITY table.
Activity class of the activity can only be APPLYPAYMENT
activity of payment rules property class.

Specifies if the amounts made due to the customer, between the simulation start date and payoff effective date, should be considered settled or not. By setting this field to YES, auto settlement of future dues would be enabled and setting it to null or NO will not settle the due amounts automatically.
Validations:
Can be either YES or NO or blank.
When set to YES, the SETTLE.DUE.ACT is mandatory.

Action defining what should happen with any shortfall within tolerance.

REMAIN or <blank> - the short balances will remain on the loan for the bank to deal with manually. If the shortage is on an interest bearing balance (e.g. Principal), it can continue to accrue interest.
WRITE.OFF – the amount will be written off according the accounting rules defined by the bank.

No input and multi value field lists all fields that have been negotiated for each dated version of the property. For a subsequently dated property, the attributes listed in this field will appear in "Negotiated.Fields" and only newly negotiated fields will appear on "Changed.Fields"
Optional field - Allowed Values are RESETTING and NON-RESETTING.
RESETTING - During any Renewal Activities (for eg : change.product, rollover or reset) the property conditions will be reset from the product.
NON-RESETTING - During any Renewal Activities property conditions will be maintained from the Arrangement level.
Leaving the field blank sets NON-RESETTING as the default option.
